description:
I was absolutely starving when I arrived so take my review with a grain of salt. 
Immediately ordered the burrata and fried chicken sliders. Burrata was perfect but the sliders could have used some more sauce or something. They seemed a tad dry to me. Also ordered the pork chop to split and it was perfect and the veggies were delicious!
Our bartender was honestly pretty quiet and didn't invoke in any of the conversation starters we threw his way which was a little strange to me. But he was very knowledgeable about the wine and that's what's important! 
Really cool atmosphere that isn't too loud! Will definitely be back!
author: Maggie R.

description:
Great local spot on Clement in the Inner Richmond! Came here with a friend for wine and lite bites. Atmosphere is approachable and felt like a tasting room in wine country. It wasn't too crowded but had a steady stream of patrons-one of the groups actually brought their kids and the bar set up a table for them with crayons and fries which I thought was cute. 

We tried a glass of white each and a Rosé. When we first inquired about the menu, the first two things my friend asked about were not available which I always find disappointing at a bar/restaurant in general.

The wines we did try were great and I wish I could remember the names but the person who helped us had great suggestions so you probably can't go wrong. They do give you a generous taste before you commit to a glass.

For food we did a bowl of their popcorn (porcini brown butter) and a toast with burrata and English peas. The toast was AMAZING (fresh and bright flavors) and we immediately tried to figure out what was in it so we could recreate for ourselves. Popcorn was also surprisingly addicting as well.

All in all a great place to stop in for a drink and a bite. I liked that it wasn't too loud so I could actually have a conversation with my girlfriend and not have to shout. Liked the ambiance a lot (wine crates and records). Worth a visit!
author: Semuteh F.

description: Found this place thanks the to the Yelp and I am SO HAPPY to have found it. We came here at 2pm on a Sunday and spent over an hr here. I am a red wine kind of person and more in the dry side but I was looking for a sweeter dry red today. The bar tender suggested Vocal Vineyards and let me tell you....YOU NEED TO DRINK THIS! It's so crisp and perfect as a mid day wine. I also tried the P.Quiles Vermouth and it's absolutely amazing. The bartenders were so friendly and warm that they made it feel like I was already a regular even though it was my first time here. They have an awesome record selection and if you ask they will play what you request! I will definitely be coming back here again and suggest this place to EVERYONE!!!!
author: Yochabel U.

description: Would really like more of a selection of wines, I think it is a little small. I like the atmosphere inside. Some of the wine is overpriced but to be expected when places mark up wines 2-3x it's value
author: Christina M.

description: Cute wine bar with with a nice selection of wines, I was surprised by the good selection of beers too. The octoberfest was really good. Their duck fat fries were very good too...thin shredded fries. I've never had fries like that. Hard to eat in a classy way but they are good. Don't order it on a date! Lol.
author: P S.

description:
I'd been wanting to check out High Treason for quite some time and finally got my chance last week. It's been open for about a year and a half, and I doubt it's going anywhere anytime soon. It's great! 

If you're looking for great wines at great prices and small fare to match, then this is a great stop. It's also a fantastic addition to the neighborhood as the Inner Richmond continues to improve. They play some awesome vinyl throughout the bar and the turntables are set right on the bar. Rad. The staff was super knowledgeable and poured a few different tastes of some of the more geeky wines (which I later purchased). 

I'll be back for sure...
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Excellent wine bar - more calm and sleek in style than homey or is it Homie! 

I've been here a few times and it is a place to go with people, the staff was semi-talkative, very calm dispositions in a serene atmosphere. 

We had a group of 4, Bobby J, The Saint (he really is), Sammie, and myself - we shared several bottles. One was a White Bordeaux, Cuvee des Conti, and Wow, it was delicious, beautiful subtle complexities in a well structured wine (Sauvignon Blanc / Semillion blend). 

Then we got into a domestic GSM (Grenache, Syrah, Mourvedre blend made in Rhone style but made in U.S.) Not sure if you want all of that description but another excellent selection. 

I personally loved the art that adorned the walls and above the bar itself is this really cool conglomerate of wooden wine boxes. The really great wines come in these kinds of boxes. When you're buying for a high end restaurant you have too many of these boxes which should be used in an art form. 

Also enjoyed several food items, the truffle oiled popcorn was outstanding - so much flavor. 
And we all enjoyed the various tapas that were available, I think we ordered most of what was on the menu - that wine makes ya hungry. 

Great place - enjoyed the wines and my people, I would recommend for a quiet evening with good conversation.
author: Rew C.

description:
Cute little spot in the inner Richmond. Ordered some small bites- duck fat fries were good!! (See pic) 

Wide selection of wines and craft beers. I would recommend the old world Spain bubbles.
author: Nabiha J.

description:
This is a great wine bar if you find yourself in the Richmond. While I don't love the all-stool seating (which gets uncomfortable after a while) the food & drink are excellent, they sell bottles to go, and I love that they are playing vinyl albums from start to finish. (It helps that all of my favorite albums are on display there.)

The staff is very friendly and happy to make recommendations in language that anyone can understand. The bread and house butter is excellent, as is the popcorn with the porcini butter. There are many other snacks I would like to try!

It's not the cheapest spot, but it is a great one!
author: Rachel R.

description:
Had a mini college reunion here on a Wednesday, and I was pleasantly surprised how thoughtfully tasteful their design was. Lots of cool art lines the walls, along with wine bottles and their crates. 

This specially long and dark establishment fits in with the other eclectic shops that line the street and drew an impossible crowd for 7 pm on a Wednesday. They had a nice variety of wines, beers and some less common vermouths and cognacs. That being said there were pricy. They only sell by the glass, no bottles, and their glasses go up to $19 each for decent but not amazing wines. 

While I thoroughly visually enjoyed the space, it's really hard for me to justify giving this place more than 3 stars, given that other than a nice interior, the experience was very average.
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
High Treason is a quaint little wine bar on Clement street, difficult to find (due to lack of signage), but easily accessible. We popped in for a drink on a Saturday afternoon, to find the place mostly empty (makes sense given the neighborhood).

I forget that my dislike of wine bars is the mark-up price per glass. We ordered champagne that was $18/glass, out of a bottle that costs ~$36 total. I guess if you ONLY like drinking wine in a fairly chill social setting, and are happy to eat the mark-up, then this is a good place? I'm not a wine bar person, so my stance is not super positive.

Service is fine, small bites are available in the kitchen, and the art is nice, at least.
author: Claire S.

description: This is a great wine bar, nice choices of wine, informative servers, fun beer list as well.  But what makes it special, it truly feels like our neighborhood wine bar.  We have been going to it since it opened but last week was extra special.  We had my family from Santa Rosa having to stay with us do to evacuation.  We were seated in the middle, a little loud, but works.  The table next to us were two nice ladies talking about helping victims of the fire.  When they found out my sister and her husband were victims, they took care of our bill!!!  What an act of kindness!!!  This place attracts nice people, fun spot to stop in for neighborhood cheer!!!!  I haven't tried the small plates but they look really good, will continue to frequent, great for the Inner Richmond!!!
author: Carole W.

description:
Looks like I'm kind of the odd ball out: while most people rave about this place, I can't say I loved my visit here. 

You know what I think it is that didn't make me fall in love with this place: it made me feel inferior and unsophisticated. Why? - Well, I like drinking a glass of wine, but I honestly can't tell a high quality wine from a bad quality wine. I understand that the folks who opened up High Treason are sommeliers of some of the finest establishments. And my friend - who is a true wine expert - verified that they really have excellent wines on offer; if also pricey ones. But for me that just wasn't enough as I - as a wine dumbo- felt somewhat dwarfed and mediocre in this space...and that didn't feel good. 

For me the surrounding atmosphere and the people that I'm with is much more important. And honestly the atmosphere also didn't agree with me: I thought it was a cold space. Both in the literal sense of the word and also in the figurative one. Maybe they were trying to recreate the atmosphere of a drafty wine cellar in the French wine regions? It's all very straight-lines, clean cuts and minimal decoration...and I like a wine bar to feel like my living room. Guess I should be drinking from home more often!



Highlight was the bread from Pain bakery!
author: Uli B.

description:
We LOVE Kennan!! Friendliest person here. 
A real gentleman. Why is he hid away in the back? He knows his stuff.
Hugs to Kennan.
Wine was delicious, if over priced.
We miss the Coravin! So nice to have to be able to try vintage or unique vintners.
Loved the cheese. Esp the blue cheese.
Fourme Ambert
Loved the Tokaj.
Also, art, is stunning and deep.
author: Lucy P.

description:
Met up a girlfriend here on Thursday, October 27th around 6:30pm. It was a rainy night, so it wasn't too packed when I showed up. (It did get a little busier as the night went on.) My gf got there about a half hour before I did, so she snagged a couple stools along the wall.

*Rafael et Fils, "Estate," Cabernet Sauvignon, Oak Knoll, Napa Valley, 2012 ($19) x4
*Domaine de Cristia, "Cuvee Tradition," Chateauneuf-du-Pape, Rhone Valley, France, 2014 ($13)
*Vocal, "Lilo Vineyard," Pinot Noir, Santa Cruz Mtns, 2013 ($21)
*Alain Voge, "Les Peyrouses," Cote du Rhone, France, 2014 ($14)

My favorite was, of course, the Cabernet Sauvignon. My gf had that first and then went to a Pinot. She then went back to the cab cuz that was her favorite as well. I started with the Chateauneuf-du-Pape and then asked the server what he would recommend to follow that. He suggested the Cote du Rhone which was a nice follow up. I ended the night with the cabernet. I honestly don't know much about wines. I just know what I like when I drink it. Typically full bodied and bold, so the cab fit that nicely.

The servers were very sweet and helpful. The space has a little swank to it, but it still feels cozy. They were sweet enough to give us a small bowl of Popcorn gratis. I believe it was porcini and brown butter. My gf kept thinking it had a foie type of flavor, but I found it a little more earthy. Kind of like truffle popcorn without the intoxicating truffle aroma.

Very cute wine bar in the Inner Richmond. If I'm in the area again and want some wine, I'd definitely stop by.
author: Elena N.

description:
The best bar in the Richmond district...and definitely one of the best in all of SF.  Nice, moody ambiance at night, bright and open during the day.

Unique and high quality wine & beer menu, along with addictive bar bites.  The truffle popcorn is to die for! I can't stress enough the coolness of this place...so glad it's just blocks from my home!
author: Kim W.

description: Wine lovers: this is the place you've been waiting for. Every time I visit San Francisco, I make a stop at High Treason. The wine selection is fab, the food is good, staff friendly, and the music selection: to die for. It's my secret haunt but I don't want it to be secret anymore​. Everyone needs to go here!
author: Theresa R.

description:
Please don't come here. Don't order the popcorn. Don't have fun ordering wines. Don't order food. Leave me all the seats!!

For real though, taste the wine before committing to a glass. There are a great many hits but still the occasional miss.

I'd come before with pals but didn't really get it. I was in a beer mood and not a sit, chat, and linger over yummy nibbles. If you like chatting over wine and nibbles, this is your place. 

Also, the bathroom is cute.
author: Loli L.

description:
The Inner Richmond is fortunate to have High Treason as a new neighbor. Very unassuming from the street (a plain, brown storefront without a sign) this wine bar is gorgeous once inside. This beautiful wine bar with stellar service and unique selections would be right at home in the Mission. It's a lucky placement in the Richmond, and gives an indication where this neighborhood may be headed.

Now that I'm living in Marin, I find meeting friends in the city involves finding an "in between" spot and have now spent some time discovering this neighborhood that seemed completely out of the way when I actually lived in the city. Always great for Korean, Vietnamese and dim sum, now things are really opening up here and High Treason is as good as it gets due to their terrific low key staff and excellent wine pours.  These guys know their stuff and I was delighted to discover Bodega Perez Pascuas version of "El Pedrosal" by the glass, a dark inky mystery of a tempranillo. Do order their crisp croquettes with melty, savory manchego and jamon interior. 

The wine was so good that we both purchased a bottle to take home, after drinking a glass. If you are a local you can take away for 40% off the bottle price, if you are taking a bottle out the door to go.  A relative bargain. Come here for wine and a small nosh for a tapas-like experience in an attractive setting with knowledgable, friendly staff.
author: Rachel H.

description:
One of my favorite spot for a glass of wine, or many glasses :)!
The selection is very well made, with a good turnover of the btg option.
The design of the place too is chic and cosy.
author: Geraldine F.

description: Total rip-off. Menu price will only get you a half a glass. Deceptive.  I asked Carissa if it was a full pour and she confirmed.  When the server saw I was taking a pic to post a review, she rushed over to pour a couple more sips in.
author: D. S.

description: Love this neighborhood wine bar - great vibe, feels trendy without being snobbish. Prices are reasonable and their small bites are delicious!
author: Eleni L.

description:
Beautiful space with a decent selection of cheaper wines (as well as expensive bottles for when you want to splurge).

Popcorn was cold and quite a ripoff. Would not recommend.

Staff was helpful in picking out wines and very nice about tasting a few before ordering. They actually poured the wrong, pricier wine for my friend but were great about charging the lower price since it was their mistake.
author: Ke D.

description:
Please note that I'm a beer drinker....

One of my favorite bars in the Richmond-- very unique menu with a combination of domestic and imported beers that I haven't seen anywhere else. They updated their menu pretty often so you'll always see something new when you go there. Workers are very knowledgeable about their stuff and the ambiance is refreshing to see in the Richmond, which primarily consists of dive bars. Definitely a hidden gem in the area.
author: Kelvin C.

description:
I was pretty disappointed. The deviled eggs were moderately good and the charcuterie/cheese was good, but they forgot both until we asked about both. As an apology we got some extra crostinis; pretty lame.

This place wasn't terrible, just doesn't deserve its current 4  1/2 stars. Nothing special about it
author: Maximilian T.

description:
Wine bar is very appropriately named for the size of its minuscule wine pours.
At first I thought she had confused my order with a tasting, but nope...

Food was ok. Decor was ok. 

Vinyl record vibe is hip. 

Overhyped.
author: Brian M.

description: Very cool place, they must have like hundreds or original wine wood boxes or crates used to ship wine these days and they're stacked up on the wall - totally awesome vibe. Wine is good and so is the food. I will be back!
author: boyan b.

description:
This place doesn't have great signage but it's easy to find from the sidewalk. 

Came here on a nice and calm Sunday night. Great ambiance and decor. 

The bartenders gave my friends and I great recommendations. Apparently what they do is order a few cases every so often in order to always have different inventory.
author: Anthony T.

description: Their list is phenomenal. Love the beats. Great place to unwind be adventurous and let your taste buds get some good work in. And can I say Mike isn't too hard on the eyes.
author: Rosie B.

description: Popped in here for lunch on a Saturday on a bit of a whim. Food was fabulously fresh and the Brussel sprouts with cider glaze were excellent. Also really enjoyed the burrata toast with carrots and arugula. Unexpected flavor combo that my sister and I both loved. The bartender/dj was super nice and knowledgeable.
author: Alison L.

description: Stopped by after dinner to have a drink or two but ended up staying late because I was enjoying each and every glass of wine they have to offer. The wine selection is uncommon which I appreciated so I could try different varietals. It makes sense since the place is owned by a couple of sommeliers. John is an exceptional host and openly shares his honest wine experiences. I was full from dinner but had to try their popcorn with porcini butter. Let's just say I didn't have only one bowl. The food looked and smelled delicious especially the fried chicken sliders, a must order on my next visit. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I'd highly recommend stopping by for a drink or two.
author: Minh H.

description:
I went on a date here because he wanted to try it out. Sure, why not! This is a cool wine bar in a neighborhood that doesn't have very many similar options. The wine selection is good and the guy helping us was fantastic. He was so understanding and let us try the wines before we committed (even though we didn't ask for that). I felt bad that both my date and I did not like our first choice but he was very accommodating and helpful with recommending choices we would both enjoy.

I ended up with a glass of Banshee chardonnay and we chatted by the window.
author: Yi Z.

description:
I love this place!!!

Such a refreshing change of pace from the dive bars and irish pubs that encompass the entire Richmond district. 

But what I really appreciate about High Treason is that they have a great wine list that isnt just limited to California wines like many other wine bars in the area are. And the staff is very experienced and knowledgeable and have always provided me with a great recommendation. And, if you dont like the taste that they pour for you, they are very good about giving you another glass that better suites your palate. 

TBH, there hasnt been a time when I have NOT walked out of here with a bottle or two after my tasting...ooops....I mean its just that good.
author: Michael P.

description: Came here while waiting for Burma Superstar. It was so cool to find a place without a sign out front! The service, ambiance and wine were all great! I'd definitely come back if I lived there!
author: Rachel S.

description: Randomly found this cool little spot. the decor inside is great and they have a huge selection to choose from. they have a kitchen for small bites as well. Hubert is very knowledgeable and helpful in choosing the correct drink for you. if you need advice, ask for Hubert
author: Jan H.

description: I want to love this place, it's next to my house and has a solid wine selection, but....the service. Every time I have been in there the staff would rather chat with each other than help take your order. I like a wine bar where they offer options when the wine you choose is sold out and where you don't have to flag down someone for a glass of water. The popcorn is delicious, but tonight it was stale and chewy, at $4 a tiny bowl I expect better. Such potential, but they still have some work to do to be my go to wine bar.
author: Alisa S.

description:
How rare is it when a place (or person) exceeds your expectations?
Pretty rare, right?

High Treason is one of those 'rare gems' that delivers on all fronts:

Interesting, tasty wines that you have never heard of before. Check!
Small plates from a talented chef. Check!
Exceptional service from Dustin who curated our evening beautifully. Check!
DJ and 'guests' spinning records to round out the experience.  Check!

A new favorite!
author: jon k.

description:
Yay for new, hip places to drink creative beverages in the Inner Richmond! 

I have been here twice and love it. The owner spins great records, will let you taste wines before ordering and they have a beautiful wine box installation above the bar. 

The space has large skylights that fill the bar with pretty light. You can sit at the bar, high tables or low tables. They offer a range of snacks, I like the popcorn. 

My husband loves their creative been selection.

Come for a night cap or pre dinner drink or two! I have been happily married for many years but this would be a solid first date spot : )
author: Alison C.

description: Chill spot! Came here after eating some Asian food and ice cream. We were too full to try the food here, so we just got a bottle of cab to share (~$100). Light background music and good noise level, friendly staff, good ambiance, nice wines.
author: Annie S.

description: One of the best wine bars in SF. This place has a really cool vibe, great wine list, and very friendly staff. Highly recommended!
author: Adamus R.

description:
I liked High Treason and am glad I was able to check it out, as it is in an area I am rarely in. I was in the neighborhood though and decided to come by and grab some wine and food.

The food menu is small but quite interesting. I tried the fried quail, duck fat fries, and a couple glasses of wine; they also gave me complimentary olive bread and butter. Overall, everything was really salty which made it a little hard to enjoy. The quail was fried pretty nicely and was tasty but was just overwhelmingly salty after a few bites. It came with some veggies (squash mostly) and the veggies were actually my favorite thing I ate at High Treason. Fries were good at first, but again, really salty and one note after a while. I liked them more when I soaked them in the broth(?) that the quail was on top of. I think I would have preferred the fries to be just a tad thicker (I do like thin fries but these were crazy thin, more like a garnish) and with some kind of sauce. The butter that came with the bread was excellent but the bread itself was again oddly salty (maybe because of the olives in it?). 

They also have a wine and beer list that has some pretty good options. My favorite thing was a sparkling red wine which I unexpectedly really enjoyed. The prices skew slightly on the high side, even compared to other SF bars (I have had the same beer I had here for $1-2 less at a bunch of places for example) but nothing too crazy. 

The verdict: a pretty nice menu and great space and atmosphere. The flavors and cooking of the food was good; the seasoning was definitely too heavy overall. I would definitely consider coming back if in the area, but wouldn't come out of my way to come here. 3.5 stars probably but rounding up because the saltiness was the main reason it wasn't 4 stars and that is a pretty easy fix.
author: Seema U.

description:
Very cute wine bar. Stopped in real quick before our dinner at Wako.
We tried the porcini popcorn, yum! Can't wait to try their other snacks.
Wine was good also, decent price/ high end. Pour was okay.

Servers are pretty friendly, try to sit at the bar, if not, they'll bring a menu to you too.
Would be even more awesome if they had a happy hour!
author: Christine M.

description: Great neighborhood spot! Definitely nice to have a high caliber wine bar in the Richmond district. Friendly servers and wide selection of options. Love the decor and vibe of the place = simple, unpretentious...just a solid good place to get drinks.
author: Tiffany W.

description: This is by far the best wine bar in San Francisco. The people are incredibly welcoming and super knowledgeable about wine. You can't find a bad glass or bottle there. My advice...go...now.
author: Simon F.

description: They serve wine, sake, beer here! I like the environment here. Came here for drinks before food. Great place to socialize since it doesn't get too noisy.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Another great opening in the Richmond District recently! We stopped by for their grand opening tonight and were not disappointed.

The space has a modern look to it with the gray painted walls and dark tables, but the large skylights above the main seating area help give the otherwise heavy space a level of lightness. The wall adjacent to the bar has a variety of contemporary paintings, and directly above the bar is a nice installation utilizing wine crates. I really like how they approached seating at High Treason - abundant wine bar seating, a few high tables, a few low tables, and standing room with a ledge. There is also seating upstairs that we will need to check out next time!

The wine list is very French-heavy, but seriously you could choose any of the wines on that list and be happy. I had the Cava Rosé, which was exactly what I needed on a warm afternoon. My boyfriend had the Lambrusco and was equally happy. John is an exceptional sommelier and answered our questions with ease and enthusiasm. Rachel also has a great knowledge of the wine and beer at High Treason and helped my bf choose a delicious and yeasty Kölsch for his next drink. High Treason's list also includes a cider section, sherry section, and dessert wine selection.

We also got to try out some nibbles from the kitchen - a walnut levain with salt-flaked butter is complimentary and quite delightful (paired well with my Cava!). We also tried their sampler and were especially pleased with the selection for $10 - a ham pâté toast with kumquat, a marinated carrot salad with ricotta and slivered almond, Serrano ham and manchego croquette, and grape in Gorgonzola with almond crust. We savored each bite and loved the combination of tastes on the plate.

We can't wait to come back to High Treason for another visit! Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Liz G.

description:
1st person: The ambiance... What's with this?

2nd person: Yah, why am I sitting in a long gray tunnel?! 

1st: High Treason? Missed opportunities. This could have been a pirate wine bar.

2nd: Arrrrrrr, they're just after my booty. Not even a full pour!
author: Ani L.

description: Im a fan of one if the owner/somms here going back to various restaurants. Benu, TFL, Quince, Bar Tartine. Oodles of wine knowledge and experience....i never pick he always chooses. Had a grenache medley which was fantastic. Ready for them to get out if sift opening and go prine time. Hopefully the kitchen will be up as well
author: Kim N.

description:
I am so in love with this space!! This is such a great addition to the neighborhood, what a gem!  I am not a drinker but I love being social and meeting up my friends who live in the area. The bars are kind of loud and dirty. This place is nice and modern.

The owners (John and Michael?)  and sommeliers (Dustin)  are very nice and knowledgeable.  Above and beyond for service!  My glass of water was never empty and they didn't make me feel uncomfortable just because I don't drink. 

I am looking forward to their food menu!
author: Suzzie B.

description:
Yes, yes, a thousand times yes!

A completely unexpected spot to have in the Inner Richmond but what a find. A very nice ambiance and then there's the food and wine...

Wine: good selection to choose from, a little on the pricier side but still worthwhile.

Food: this is actually where High Treason won me over. 
-They had popcorn with porcini browned butter on it that was to die for! If this is still on the menu, you must order it! 
-The fries were also delicious and I would totally order them again
We didn't get the mains but I'd definitely come back and try more food :)
author: Rachel R.

description: A really nice place! I was here for a little birthday gathering, and we had such a good time. I had a glass of wine, some amazing olives, mind-blowing croquets, and some crispy little fries. I left kind of hungry, but we were headed to dinner anyhow. :)
author: Helen K.

description:
Not a huge fan of this place. 

1.wine is ridiciously over priced for their selection. The wine on tap is so gross.   
2. The bartender, an older gentleman with a beard was awful. When we first entered, we asked to sit at a table for 4 and he said "Ill be right there to push the tables together" He got distracted so we ended up doing it ourselves and  he stood there and watched, didnt say sorry for not helping or even pretend he was going to come over and help, just stood there at an empty bar and watched 3 ladies push tables together
3. When I asked the bartender what are some good snacks on the menu he said "anything on the menu"  Didnt make any suggestions (at least pick a couple things,even if you dont like them and use them as your go to when people ask)
4. No background music, just stale air in a hollow dark (like really dark, cant see the person across from you) bar.

I want say there is potential, but not sure how they can make it work.
author: Leslie M.

description:
Stopped in here after dinner.  They have a nice upscale ambiance with speedy and expert wine service.  They have a large wine selection, modest beer selection, and unexpectedly sake, and sherry sections.  The servers, who i believe are wine experts offer tastings of every wine before you order the full glass.  Although there is no formal tasting menu were told they would do "half pours" if we wanted more variety.   

I will definitely be back here when I'm in the mood for wine.
author: Dan O.

description:
I would give this a 3.5, but you can only choose whole numbers. 

Service here was great and each of us had an excellent white wine based off our server's recommendations from what we told her we liked. Decor and ambience is unique for the area and very pleasant. 

The croquettes were superb and a good size for the price. The only mar on this experience was the portion size and  taste of the papperdelle pasta. For something with house made sausage and sundried tomatoes, the flavor was very lacking. 

Overall, would come here again for the wine.
author: Devyn R.

description: I don't understand why my beer came in a wine glass. I also don't understand why the teeny tiny servings of popcorn are $4 a pop. Definitely doesn't fit in with the vibe of the Inner Richmond, but a good spot to take your basic Marina friends.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Very attentive service.  Amazing wine selection with some tasty food selections.  Staff super knowledgeable about wines. Cool decor and its a great date place. Minimal signage gives the place a cool mystique vibe.
author: Hao T.

description: Our favorite wine bar! And now they serve lunch! The short rib sandwich is perfect on a chilly day. I wanted to order another one as I was eating the first one. I received great advice on a nice pairing, too.
author: Claire P.

description:
Amazing!

The food is outstanding and the wine selections really stand out.  One of the best new places in town!
author: John K.

description: Stopped in here randomly before going to the Turkish restaurant down the street for dinner and could not have been happier that we did. I mean for one, we got to enjoy some delicious Lambrusco so they already scored from that regard. But really we first went to the divey bar next door and literally immediately walked out and I said out loud "I wish there was just a chill place that we could hang out in for a bit" and I turn to my left and there it is. Really, if you like wine, like relaxing, like good music, like chill atmospheres, then this place is for you. I like in Oakland but am still finding ways to make it back out to High Treason -- I'll definitely be making my way back soon! The service was awesome as well which only helped.
author: Neechi M.

description:
Really cute hole-in-the-wall wine bar in the inner richmond! The interior is very quaint with just enough accent from the different paintings on the wall + the vast decoration of wine lineage boxes above the bar. 

The wine list is pretty extensive and really focuses on old world wines, which I really appreciated. Definitely gets you into exploring old world wines if you're used to new world. :)

They also have a nice selection of ciders, beers, and sakes to choose from + a few small bites and plates.
author: Rachel C.

description: What a treat! We came here to try the food and wine, and see my friend Bob the chef. I have to say, Bob has always made great food for his friends when they come over but this was the first time I have ever eaten at one of his restaurants (yes I am a bad friend :( I must say,  l was blown away!! I had no idea he could cook like this. Either he was holding out on us this hold time, or his skills blew up exponentially since I last ate over his house. Haha! Everything was so delicious and there were many wine and beer pairing possibilities with the food. We had the Cajun fried chicken sliders on a brioche bun, with a fort point saison beer for me and Schneider Pinot noir wine for my wife. The chicken was so crispy and juicy, seasoned perfectly and came together so well with the house coleslaw and creamy Cajun sauce. We also had the best bruschetta I've ever had in my life! Kale pesto base, portobello mushroom and candied walnuts - amazing I must say. Then, the ham and manchego cheese croquettes were off the hook and so was the sugar snap peas with ricotta, mushrooms and mint. The ambiance is really cool, high ceilings and openness is nice. Check this place out soon!
author: Brandon N.

description: This wine bar it's great for a nice evening with a friend or significant other. Great collections of wine and the ambience was a bit mellow low (we did go early). Overall it's a great to enjoy a great conversation and enjoy your favorite wine.
author: Valeria B.

description: Hip hop records meets modern art meets unique and delicious wines (and beers). I've been here many times and have never drank the same wine twice. They are always changing up their wine list and I have enjoyed each glass from the various parts of the world. There is a drink for everyone here. There is also a coziness about this place.. not sure if it's the music, the people & service, or the location. Only downside is they close at 11pm but they stayed open for us when we walked in after closing time :)
author: Christine H.

description: Great wine bar!   Amazing selection.   John is a great host! A must. Complete with a turntable and skylights.   Open front for a great view. They have sparkling cider and and international selection.
author: Tammie H.

description: Cute place. Looks like pictures posted on Yelp. Cava good but served in wine glass NOT flute - seriously bad idea. Bartenders knowledgable and supplied tastes. Pasta dish was excellent.
author: Susan E.

description: Fun, stylish wine bar with eclectic selection of wines, as well as delicious foods from the kitchen. Service is super friendly and informed about wines offered. Worth the travel to the Richmond district to spend time with friends, new and old.
author: Keiko S.

description: Been here a few times. Every time I thought the place was expensive. On my last visit the pours were worse than in the previous times. My advice to the management: generosity and customer service will take your business to a better place.
author: Anne L.

description:
I highly recommend this nice little beer and wine bar in the Richmond. 

As you know, the Richmond is good for dive bars, and I've been looking for something like High Treason for a while. Very good selection of wines and some interesting beers on tap. I got a sour and a saison, both of which were good. The server knew everything about the menu and offered tastes if we wanted. The bread and butter was outstanding. Not sure where they get it, but it hit the spot. 

Glad to have a fun place like this in the neighborhood! Oh, and the music is good. They play a nice selection of vinyl.
author: Noah D.

description:
To Michael, Nicole, Dustin, and John:

Thank you for bringing wine to our neighborhood. You have created an atmosphere where fine wine is accessible, unpretentious, and appreciated. You have taught us the art that is wine, but have also maintained the integrity and simplicity of the grape. I am not afraid to ask questions, but am confident in my limited knowledge. You are approachable, yet refined. You are needed and appreciated. We welcome you with open arms and a thankful palate.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Cool treat. Was curious to check this place out after reading the Yelp reviews.  It held up to my expectations and more.... Really nice decor, love the "street" vibe with the cool art work and vinyl records playing.  Not the typical Richmond feel.  Love the wine selection, owner John's belief is good wine for a reasonable price with knowledgeable and good service. We told him the types of wine we like and his first recommendation was spot on.  After our tummies were filled with happiness, we left with two bottles to bring back home which were pleasantly discounted for a take out price. We will definitely be back to try more wines.  Thanks John for a great date night.
author: Happiness S.

description: Well I'd never felt that Clement Street needed a fancy wine bar, but it's 2016 so I guess here we are. That being said, High Treason is a pretty nice fancy wine bar and I dig the decor, the snacks were good (blah blah fancy bread and butter blah blah) and the staff was friendly and informative. Anyways, I hope this isn't a sign of major chances in the neighborhood where I was born, but having a spot like High Treason (as long as it's only one spot) is pretty nice.
author: Misha T.

description: Had a great time having drinks prior to going to Burma Superstar. What an awesome new spot.
author: Patrick L.

description:
High Treason is one of new favorite spots in the city! They have an extensive wine by the glass list, all reasonably priced and very good quality. I really appreciate that they have fun, wine-nerdy selections in addition to good go-to wines. 

The staff is great and very helpful if you can't decide which wine to select!
author: Rachel C.

description:
After moving to the Richmond District several months ago I've been on the lookout for cool new spots to check out and heard amazing things about this space. 

After trying it out while on a first date last weekend, I have to say I wasn't disappointed! The ambiance is on point and staff is super friendly and attentive. Plus, the popcorn? So good. This was the perfect pick for that date, and I will definitely be returning soon.
author: Kimia M.

description:
Place is ok, will depend what you are in the mood for and atmosphere. 

Walked in and the place is pretty chilly, decor is "chilly". Like a warehouse and throw in some table and metal stools (which in my opinion is not a good idea)

BF and I ordered red wines (Cultivar Cabernet and Benanti Rossidiverzella Etna Rosso -first round) and a plate of cheese. Not too impressive. Cheese was ok...could have mentioned on the menu what type of cheese...as in goat, cow or sheep). FYI...the cheese plate contain a goat and sheep combination cheese) Not a fan of goat or sheep. Order a second round of red wine to wash down the goat/sheep cheese (Domaine Gros Frere et Soeur Hautes Cotes de Nuits and Alain Voge Côtes du Rhone) Wine selection was ok, had better and in a nicer setting. But with a lot of things wine is up to you and you only. Only you know what you like and can't depend on someone's opinion. 

The reason I gave it 3 stars was because of the service. Service was cold and unfriendly. The only, only person that was nice and can change my mind about this place is Nicole. Unfortunately I didn't get her service till the end. She was patience, friendly and CHEERFUL. 

Overall I prefer a more intimate place with friendly service. After all we are PAYING customers and customer service is part of the eating experience.
author: Jenny L.

description: I love this wine bar! I just went here on a first date and the atmosphere was perfect as in the space was amazing, the music was good and the bar tenders came around to check on you and also made good recommendations. I ended up going home with a bottle of the fine disregard from stag's leap! So great... the pours could be a little bigger for the price but I still had a great time!
author: Stacy A.

description: Love this wine bar. It has a great atmosphere and great wines by the glass Their duck fat fries are delicious.
author: Jamie Lee R.

description:
I really wanted to like this place! Have been planning on trying it as it's a neighborhood spot and seemed like a great addition to the plethora of restaurants and bars on clement. I thought the space was lovely: really high ceilings to make the space feel airy and the long entrance  from the doorway to the bar was very open. 

My 2 stars is for the service: my friend had gotten there 5 minutes before me and got a table close to the bar. I arrived and had to wait 10 minutes before flagging down a server about wanting to try a taste of the wine before ordering a glass. At first I wasn't sure if we had to go to the bar to order but it definitely was table service. He forgot about us (another 10 mins) and we ended up having to flag down ANOTHER server who finally got my order. He apologized for the lack of service and said that for 3 servers, it's no excuse. (Thank you, I appreciated that). He started pouring a full glass without me tasting and honestly, by that point, I had been waiting 20+ mins for a glass of wine that it didn't matter what I ordered. After we got the wine, I wanted to order food and couldn't get anyone to take my order. It was only after my friend flagged down the bus boy did we get our order in. I ordered the duck fries and it came out but much gastronomically "savvy" than I imagined. It was tiny, tiny slivers, smaller than shoestring fries. They also didn't have ketchup-fine, not a big deal. 

I wanted to stay for another glass but was so put off by the service that we got the bill and left. I was bummed about the service and experience as others had spoken so highly of it. I'll aim to try it again and hope that the 3 servers there were just having a bad night.
author: Angela H.

description: If you want to get into wine--like really good wine... 5 star restaurant type wine--but you don't know anything about it, and you want an environment that's not stuffy, with a knowledgeable staff who can help you decide and help you figure out what you like, try High Treason. Owned by sommeliers with a legit pedigree but zero ego, this place is a beautiful, modern looking spot with great wine and great records spinning.
author: Will G.

description: This is an excellent wine bar. Thanks to yelp for helping me find this. It's in A working class neighborhood, in my opinion way to upscale for the neighborhood. It's like a little diamond. If you like to explore the not so touristy part of town then definitely check this place out!
author: Sugardumplin Z.

description: Went about 5:30. First thing it is soooo Dark inside.  I had to request a candle and then used the flashlight on the Iphone to read the menu.  Service is good, they knew their wine.  Had the cheese platter, which was good, however they only gave you 3 slices of toasted bread , which were really small, had to keep asking for more to eat with the cheese.  I would recommend  giving the place more light and more options on the appetizers to eat with you wine.  Not sure if i will be back, it was also cold inside.
author: Susie S.

description: Been here twice and not a fan. This is a somm's bar and hopefully you know one of them. In fact, I saw one of them from the Netflix documentary this evening. While the list by the glass is impressive, not all the wines are very good, especially at their price point of $16-25 a glass. Service is curmudgeonly and cold (too busy flipping vinyl to side B) if you're not sitting at the bar and the staff asks no questions about the list vs. customer preferences... do you like fruit forward, dry, off dry, acid, spice, etc. None of that. I know my wine, but I'm not a somm and dont know all of your list. Bring your wine app and stretch your thumbs for multiple searches if you do stop by. I don't think they'll be around in a year.
author: Tom W.

description: Love this spot! Great wine selection (from all over the world!), tasty food and the folks behind the bar are so knowledgeable and helpful. I could eat buckets of the popcorn and the Brussels sprouts and bacon were cooked to perfection. Def check it out!
author: Andrea J.

description: I am so excited to have a wine bar in the inner Richmond. They are just getting started and they fill a big void. I'm happy to have them and I'm excited to see them develop with their customers. The staff that I've met so far are all really positive and interesting people.
author: Gwynessa B.

description: Came in thinking there was a special on a bottle of wine. Apparently it was just for buying the bottle of wine to go. My friend and I end up sitting down and paying full price. The server was knowledgable of wine and acted as if we didn't know much about wine. I think she was thrown off by the fact that we just wanted to get the "special". She dropped the slight attitude after she realized we were funny. We ordered the shoestring fries that were fried in duck fat. So crunchy and small, but definitely worth it.
author: J B.

description: Friendly low key unpretentious wine bar with nice selection of wines. The porcini popcorn is tasty too :D
author: Anna V.

description: I've been here twice in the late afternoon, and both times I've had great wines and attentive service.  The space is bright, spare and cheerful.  There is at least one sommelier on the premises, and she's extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The wine by the glass selection is varied and interesting, and the bites I've had so far (the croquettes) were really well done.  What a great new addition to the neighborhood!
author: Amanda C.

description: Fantastic addition to the area! Really cool vibe, super extensive wine list with literally something for everyone. The owners and staff clearly know wine and are happy to explain everything to you and make sure you've found the perfect glass - all without making you feel like an idiot, so bonus points for the non-snobby attitude! They also sell bottles to take home or to BYO at any of the nearby restaurants, FYI. Will definitely be back!
author: Brooke W.

description: Their Zinfandel was good! It has a neighborhood bar kind of vibe.
author: Sophia L.

description: The Inner Richmond FINALLY has a wine bar and the owners got it right!! Great selection of wines at a good price point, a relaxed atmosphere, and very knowledgeable and friendly sommeliers.
author: Emily V.

description: Stoked to have this place in the Inner Richmond. Respectable selection at some surprisingly well priced glasses and bottles.  The place was so new that it still smelled like paint- looking forward to when that wears off. The art that lines the walls is a great touch and I can see this place hosting a few art shows. Very happy to have this place in the neighborhood!
author: Felipe E.

description: Inner Richmond has a wine bar. Great wine selection at a fair price. Had six glasses of very fine wine for under $80. Knowledgable service and eclectic selection.
author: Luciano M.

description: Love this place! I am a sucker for a good wine bar and this place does not disappoint! Came here on a relaxed Saturday afternoon and left even more relaxed. Will definitely be back (again and again...)!!
author: Sahra Likes Coffee S.

description: Friendly service and great wine choices. Nice space. Thrilled to have this new addition to our neighborhood. Would love to see a food menu. Very limited food options for now....hoping for more soon.
author: Karen F.

description: Excellent wine bar run by a couple of great guys with extensive experience.   A really wonderful wine menu and terrific bar menu that rivals any of the other "big name" restaurants in the city.   If you're in the Sunset, check it out.
author: Max K.

description: My wife and I discovered this wine bar on a walk and REALLY enjoyed it. We had a few interesting vintages by the glass - 4 home runs. High Treason has great ambiance, vinyl music, and the guys behind the counter really know their wine. I dig this spot in the Richmond and will stop by again ASAP.
author: Alexander M.

description: Do NOT go here... Only because I don't want to share this lovely little wine bar!! The staff is very friendly and happy to chat about the wine, even when they are very busy. Very reasonable prices and an impressive list by the glass. The food is very good too!! I stop in here about once a week and have yet to be disappointed on any level.
author: Jessica E.

description: Great space, friendly super knowledgeable staff and a huge variety of wines and beers.  High Treason is a great addition to the neighborhood. I'll be back for sure!
author: Grace L.

description: What a wonderful little wine bar! The wine list had a fantastic, unique selection of various wines ranging in price points. The staff were very knowledgeable about each wine and service was spot on. We ended up ordering a small charcuterie plate that was delicious! Cool local art displayed as well. So happy this place is in my hood.
author: Brooke S.

description: Great place to meet for drinks and small dishes. we had delicious wines and interesting creative dishes. We loved the cheese plate and the charcuterie plate. The brown bread they served was unusually good. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful.
author: Martha N.

description: Great new spot, this neighborhood needed a bar somewhere between dive and fancy, an unpretentious comfortable spot to enjoy a good glass of wine or a snack. I took a first date here, the music wasn't too loud and it wasn't too dark or bright. The people who work here were friendly and happy to help me choose a wine. There's plenty of seating where you don't have to be seated directly on top of your neighbor, unlike similar spots around town. I look forward to returning often.
author: Beth D.

description: So glad we now have this great little wine spot in the neighborhood! Great wine and the staff is very friendly, definitely going to frequent this place.
author: Kelsey C.

description:
Simply put the best wine bar in San Francisco.  The owners here simply awesome, and have put together a serious list for casual drinkers to Master Somms alike. Sit at the bar and have a well priced glass of interesting and delicious wine, listen to the great music, and make sure to get some food. Popcorn should be renamed Michelin Popcorn because its star worthy.  Its that good.

High Treason is a can't miss!
author: Richard C.

description: We pleasantly chanced upon this location, while looking for a relaxed place to sit and talk.  No distracting Musak, TV, -- just minimal decor and a massive selection of interesting wines about which they are knowledgable. Note -  it still say's "The Bitter End" outside, so look carefully to find the address.
author: John-Mark A.

description:
Good decently priced wine and attentive service.

We also ordered the cheese plate and some fries to munch on. The portions on the food were less that I had expected.

I'd come back for the wine, but pass on the food.
author: Timothy G.

description: Amazing list offered by the glass, Food and service are top notch. This place is another reason why Clement street is becoming a true destination spot. Worth checking out!
author: Lenny K.

description: great music and vino selection. chill.
author: Mary S.

description:
Great for Place for a Private Party!

My wife (and I) threw an engagement party for my daughter at High Treason.  It was called a buyout where we take over the wine bar for the evening (i.e. closed to the public).  It was fantastic!!!   As you can see from the pictures that others have posted, the atmosphere is great (don't let the external facade from the street dissuade you).  We "dressed up" the place further with flowers, balloons and lots of small candles (votives).   My son developed a Spotify play list that was played through High Treason's sound system so the wine bar was filled with the music we loved.   The food was very good.  However, what really stood out was the service.  Michael, the co-owner, and his staff were very friendly and extremely attentive to our needs and those of our guests - whether to recommend a type of wine, pour a glass of a favorite beer or even just get water and/or a napkin for a guest.  Great people, great ambience,  great music, great wine, great beer = great fun!
author: Bob M.

description: Charming neighborhood wine bar with nice helpful staff. Bonus, we were able to bring our young nephew as we were on the way to meet friends for dinner.
author: Kelly F.

description:
So far, not impressed. My husband and I decided to check out the new spot in our neighborhood Saturday night.  We walked in to the cold space, there was no hostess or staff to greet us, and although the place didn't look busy at all, there was not enough seating. After gazing around for how to proceed, a bartender thrust 2 wine lists at us and said "wherever you want".  Well, since we wanted food, we wanted to sit at a table or counter. The only space available was next to a turntable, where we had a clear view of people loitering about in the kitchen. None of the other customers seemed to have any food or snacks, so that wasn't a good sign. We were finally able to get the attention of another bartender, and asked if they served food. He gave us a quizzical/annoyed look and returned with the list and tossed it in front of us and walked away. 
Needless to say, we didn't feel welcome by any of this, and decided to take our business elsewhere. We hope that they are just going through some growing pains, and that our next visit will be different. Why would anyone want to stay and enjoy a glass of wine and some snacks, if they are made to feel like intruders?
We noticed there was an upstairs area, and hoped we could sit there, but it was chained off. We're guessing it's not finished yet. Better luck next time?!
author: L. S.

description: What a top notch experience! A welcome and eye contact from three of the staff upon entry. Recommendations are on point not just buzz words. I loved how the bottle was brought to table a small taste and the a glass poured upon verification. Great contemporary art, cool crowd at varying ages and styles. The charcuterie was melt in your mouth. I can't wait to see this place progress as their chef comes into play. Well done. We need more places like this.
author: Carey C.

description: So excited there's a high end wine bar in the Inner Richmond now!  This neighborhood really needed a new gem and it's finally here!  Solid wine list with great selections.  John was very friendly and happy to make some great suggestions for an indecisive lady.  He even helped create a custom party pack of bottles for me!  The Raventos i Blanc Blanc de Nit sparkling rose is a must try!  So yes, while it's a lovely place to have a few glasses of wine with your friend, it's also a great resource for purchasing for your collection. Great service, elegant but not pretentious atmosphere, eclectic art, trendy new hot spot... I've only been twice since they just opened and they are still working out the kinks but if this is a sign of things to come... this place is definitely worth checking out if you're in the area and waiting for your dinner table to be ready.
author: Angela W.

description: Nice neighborhood bar.  Dustin is great and really knows his stuff.
author: Cathy C.

description: Went to High Treason tonight with a meetup group from the South Bay.  Loved the atmosphere and the wine choices.  The owners behind the bar were friendly, helpful, attentive (there were about 25 of us) and generous.  They allowed us a couple taste tests to find the perfect glass of wine. The gave everyone a glass for water as soon as we walked in, and kept them full.  It was a great experience and hopefully we'll be back soon.
author: Vicki H.

description: 5 stars for Nicole, the great wine, and decent prices, but 2 stars for the dour-faced co/owner, the sad white walls & the weird diner chairs. It feels like it doesn't know what it wants to be when it grows up, or like an apartment you just moved into & aren't sure how to decorate.
author: KS K.
